               Standard level


                  Paper 3

mécanique, y compris des systèmes de stockage et de récupération d’informations, sans l’autorisation écrite préalable de l’IB. De plus, la
licence associée à ce produit interdit toute utilisation de tout fichier ou extrait sélectionné dans ce produit. L’utilisation par des tiers, y compris,
sans toutefois s’y limiter, des éditeurs, des professeurs particuliers, des services de tutorat ou d’aide aux études, des établissements de
préparation à l’enseignement supérieur, des fournisseurs de services de planification des programmes d’études, des gestionnaires de
plateformes pédagogiques en ligne, et des développeurs d’applications, moyennant paiement ou non, est interdite et constitue une infraction
pénale.

© Organización del Bachillerato Internacional, 2023

Todos los derechos reservados. No se podrá reproducir ninguna parte de este producto de ninguna forma ni por ningún medio electrónico o
mecánico, incluidos los sistemas de almacenamiento y recuperación de información, sin la previa autorización por escrito del IB. Además, la
licencia vinculada a este producto prohíbe el uso de todo archivo o fragmento seleccionado de este producto. El uso por parte de terceros —lo
que incluye, a título enunciativo, editoriales, profesores particulares, servicios de apoyo académico o ayuda para el estudio, colegios
preparatorios, desarrolladores de aplicaciones y entidades que presten servicios de planificación curricular u ofrezcan recursos para docentes
mediante plataformas digitales—, ya sea incluido en tasas o no, está prohibido y constituye un delito.

                                                                            –3–                                                                 8823 – 6012M

Subject Details: Biology SL Paper 3 Markscheme

Candidates are required to answer all questions in Section A and all of the questions from one option in Section B. Maximum total = 35 marks.

1.    Each row in the “Question” column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.

2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the “Total” column.

3.    Each marking point in the “Answers” column is shown by means of a semi colon ( ; ) at the end of the marking point.

4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by “max” written after the mark in the “Total” column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the “Notes” column.

5.    An alternative word is indicated in the “Answers” column by a slash (/). Either word can be accepted.

6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the “Answers” column by “OR”. Either answer can be accepted.

7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the “Answers” column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.

8.    Words inside brackets ( ) in the “Answers” column are not necessary to gain the mark.

9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.

10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the “Answers” column, unless stated otherwise in the “Notes” column.
                                                                                –4–                                                             8823 – 6012M

                                                                          Section A

    Question                                           Answers                                                          Notes                     Marks
1     a        Golgi (apparatus/body) /vesicles;                                                        Do not allow vacuoles
                                                                                                                                                    1

1     b        modifying/sorting/packaging protein/lipid/polysaccharides                                E.g. proteins, lipids, polysaccharide
               OR                                                                                       If vesicles are given for 1a, allow       1 max
               creation of lysosomes;                                                                   transport of
                                                                                                        protein/lipid/polysaccharides

1     c        allow any answer between 8000 - 10 000 (X);
                                                                                                                                                    1
1     d        greater magnification led to discovery/detail of structures (not visible with a light    Qualification needed as well as the
               microscope)                                                                              term                                        1
               OR
               greater resolution allowed details of cells to be seen;


2     a        a. as light intensity increases photosynthesis increases;                                Do not accept definition of limiting
                                                                                                        factor – response must refer to graph     3 max
               b. (this shows that) light (intensity) is the limiting factor;
                                                                                                        and explanation must be given.
               c. above 450 (au)/plateau light (intensity) is not the limiting factor / has no effect
                  on rate;
               d. (above 450/plateau) some other factor is limiting photosynthesis;
               e. example of another limiting factor;                                                   e.g. CO2, temperature


2     b        temperature/pH/carbon dioxide concentration/wavelength of light/species;                                                             1


2     c        a. photosynthesis leads to the uptake of carbon dioxide/CO2;                                                                       2 max
               b. less CO2 makes water less acidic/more alkaline / less reaction with CO2 to form       Mpb must refer to CO2
                   H+ ions;
               c. decrease in concentration of hydrogen/H+ ions (leads to an increase in pH);
                                                                         –5–                                  8823 – 6012M


    Question                                        Answers                                           Notes     Marks
3     a        to ensure that expired air flows through tube II/soda lime/ (not tube I)                           1
               OR
               to prevent inspired air backflow/flowing through the soda lime /tube II;

3     b        downward stroke (on the graph paper);                                          OWTTE
                                                                                                                  1


3     c        a. inspiration by the subject removes some of the oxygen/O2;
               b. the carbon dioxide/CO2 produced by the subject is removed/absorbed by the
                  soda lime;                                                                                    3 max
               c. this reduces the total volume of air in the box/chamber;
               d. (therefore) the pen makes a lower trace with each breath;
                                                                             –6–                                                     8823 – 6012M

                                                                        Section B

Option A — Neurobiology and behaviour

     Question                                         Answers                                               Notes                      Marks
 4     a         memory/emotions/speech/higher order thinking;                              Any verifiable example of higher order
                                                                                            thinking                                     1

 4     b    i    0.4–0.5 (mm)                                                               Accept any value within this
                                                                                            range.                                       1


 4     b    ii   a. number of branches (points) decrease;
                 b. greatest reduction of branch points at shallow depths;
                 c. shorter branches (length);                                                                                         2 max
                 d. less variation in branch length (compared with control);
                 e. neurons cannot form synapses;

 4     c         a. axons grow, branch and form dendrites;
                 b. new synapses form;                                                                                                 3 max
                 c. stimuli maintain synapses
                    OR
                    lack of stimuli eliminates synapses;
                 d. elimination of synapses is neural pruning;
                 e. plasticity allows for reorganization/memory/repair of central nervous
                    system/CNS;
                                                                          –7–                                        8823 – 6012M


    Question                                         Answers                                             Notes         Marks
5     a         retina/fovea;
                                                                                                                         1

5     b    i    a. 450-455 to 650–660 (nm);                                               Both needed for the mark
                                                                                                                         1

5     b    ii   a. different cone cells absorb light over a range of wavelengths;
                b. wavelengths overlap;
                c. colours are perceived by the relative stimulation of each cone cell;                                2 max
                d. at 510nm green is stimulated (more than red);
                e. at 610nm red is stimulated (more than green);

               than the eardrum                                                                                                         1
               OR
               loud noises are dampened by contraction of muscles between the ossicles/named
               bones;
                                                                            –9–                                                              8823 – 6012M

    Question                                          Answers                                                           Notes                  Marks
7      a       a. ectoderm cells differentiate to form the neural plate;
               b. neural plate border region forms the neural folds;
               c. the folds form a groove;                                                                                                     3 max
               d. (infolded) groove closes / folds fuse together;
               e. the tube end forms the brain;

7      b                                                                                               At least one similarity and one
               Similarities/Comparison:
                                                                                                       difference required for full marks.
               a. both control higher order functions / example of a function;
               b. both control contraction of skeletal muscle;
               c. both receive stimuli from sensory organs;

               Differences/Contrast:
               d. right (hemisphere) receives sensory input from left side of body but left
                  receives sensory input from right side                                                                                       4 max
                  OR
                  right controls activity of skeletal muscles on left side of body but left controls
                  muscles on right side;

               e. Broca’s area/speech in left side only;
               f. right receives sensory input from left side of visual field in both eyes but left
                  receives sensory input from right side of visual field in both eyes;
                                                                          – 10 –                   8823 – 6012M

    Question                                        Answers                                Notes     Marks
8     a        a. high population growth rate (of Aspergillus niger/microorganism);
               b. synthesis of commercially useful product/citric acid;
                                                                                                     2 max
               c. breakdown of organic waste/apple;


8     b        a. cooling jacket prevents high temperature from metabolism;
               b. oxygen/O2 bubbled in to replace oxygen/O2 used by respiration;
               c. release valve prevents high pressure from metabolic gases released;
                                                                                                     1 max
               d. alkali reduces acidity from carbon dioxide/CO2 made in respiration;
               e. continuous fermenter removes metabolic toxins;


8     c        Similarities:
               a. both produce metabolites using (large scale) culture of microorganisms
                  OR
                  both use probes to monitor conditions;
               Differences:
               b. continuous culture has nutrients added continually, batch at the start               2
                  OR
                  continuous harvesting compared with the end in batch culture
                  OR
                  better control of conditions in continuous culture;
                                                                         –11 –                              8823 – 6012M


    Question                                        Answers                                         Notes     Marks
9     a        a. Ti plasmid is extracted from Agrobacterium/A. tumefaciens;
               b. gene for glyphosate-resistance is inserted into Ti plasmid;
               c. recombinant plasmid/plasmid with glyphosate-resistance gene is re-inserted
                  into Agrobacterium;
               d. Agrobacterium is allowed to infect cells of the target plant species;                       3 max
               e. the recombinant/infected cells develop into adult plants that are glyphosate-
                  resistant;
               f. marker gene inserted to identify successful recombinants;


9     b
               increased natural selection for glyphosate-resistance / removes non-resistance (in               1
               weed species)
               OR
               glyphosate-resistance gene transferred from crop by pollinators/cross
               contamination;


9     c        a. strong correlations;
               b. many hospitals / over long period/20 years;
               c. correlation is not evidence of causation;                                                  3 max
               d. experimental evidence required to confirm causal link;
               e. no data relating to ethnicity/gender (so more details required);
                                                                            – 12 –                                                      8823 – 6012M


     Question                                        Answers                                                    Notes                     Marks
10     a        peptidoglycan;

                                                                                                                                            1


10     b        a. bioremediation is the use of microorganisms to remove contaminants from      Halophilic is in the stem – must have
                   environment;                                                                 explanation
                b. microorganisms used in bioremediation of saline environments must be able
                   to tolerate high salt concentrations;                                                                                  3 max
                c. Marinobacter (hydrocarbonoclasticus) is able to degrade benzene;
                d. Marinobacter uses benzene as a source of carbon compounds (for cellular
                   respiration);
                e. Marinobacter is less effective in freshwater;

10     c        a. biofilms are groups of bacteria that grow together on a surface;

                b. biofilms have emergent properties/properties not present in the individual                                             4 max
                   organisms;
                c. formation of exopolysaccharides/EPS;
                d. EPS holds the bacteria together (to form the biofilm);
                e. quorum sensing occurs;
                f. triggers expression of genes that lead to formation of biofilms;
                g. biofilm increases effectiveness of bioremediation;
                                                                            – 13 –                                                      8823 – 6012M


Option C — Ecology and conservation

      Question                                         Answers                                                        Notes               Marks
 11     a        (efficiency of) poultry production is greater than beef;                             Accept vice versa
                                                                                                                                            1

 11     b        more of the energy consumed in feed is lost as heat/wastes in beef than in poultry   Allow vice-versa
                 OR
                 longer lifespan of cattle
                 OR                                                                                   Do not accept reference to size
                 poultry may be housed                                                                difference                          1 max
                 OR
                 cattle feed on more indigestible fibre;

 11     c        a. animals remove nutrients from systems by feeding/being eaten;
                 b. nutrients added to systems by fertilizers/manure;
                 c. fertilizer/manure/organic matter run-off can affect other ecosystems;                                                 2 max
                 d. deforestation results in leaching/loss of nutrients;
                 e. pesticides may affect decomposers;




 12     a        Hawaii because (the larger the island) more habitats/ecosystems expected;            Reason required                       1

 12     b        a. colonization by pioneer species/bacteria/lichens;
                 b. erosion (of lava) leads to formation of soil;                                                                         2 max
                 c. organic matter/soil accumulates;
                 d. colonization by mosses/other plants/climax species;
                 e. plants provide habitats/food for consumers;
                                                                         – 14 –                                               8823 – 6012M


     Question                                         Answers                                                      Notes        Marks
13     a        body wall: triclosan;
                gut wall: PBDE;                                                                                                   2

13     b                                                                                            For mpc accept gut wall
                a. concentration of chemical/triclosan increases at each trophic level;

                b. Arenicola/other primary consumers take in triclosan from the sand/ocean floor;

                c. triclosan is stored in tissues of organisms;

                d. species at higher trophic levels must feed on increasing numbers of prey;                                    3 max
                e. Clupea and Scomber (feed on all lower trophic levels therefore) accumulate
                   high levels of triclosan;

                f. high levels of triclosan in species at the top of food web eaten by humans;
                                                                           – 15 –                                                      8823 – 6012M

     Question                                         Answers                                                 Notes                      Marks
14     a        allow one answer between 63 – 68 (%);
                                                                                                                                           1

14     b        a. reduced rates of seed germination;
                b. reduced dispersal;                                                                                                    2 max
                c. decreased population size/possible extinction of R.kurrangii;

14     c        a species that has a disproportionate impact on the structure/function of an    OWTTE
                ecosystem;                                                                      Do not accept food web or food chain
                                                                                               instead of ecosystem.                       1


14     d        a. (in situ conservation) is carried out in natural habitats/reserves
                   OR
                   cassowary can be maintained in its natural habitat;
                b. provides protection for ecosystem/habitat/community;
                c. cassowary can maintain its role in the habitat / maintain the food web;                                               4 max
                d. cassowary populations may be monitored so any action can be taken;
                e. natural environment allows normal behavioural development;
                f. reserves can help to raise public awareness /allow scientific study;
                g. reserves can be used to introduce individuals from breeding programs into
                   natural environments;
                                                                              – 16 –                                                     8823 – 6012M


Option D — Human physiology

      Question                                         Answers                                                      Notes                  Marks
 15     a        Strengths:                                                                          Both strengths and weaknesses for
                 a. conditions increase with BMI categories;                                         max 3
                 b. large sample;
                 Weaknesses:
                 c. CVD is highest in overweight women
                    OR                                                                                                                     3 max
                    little difference between normal and obese values for CVD;
                 d. no information on age/ethnicity/behaviour / how data was collected;
                 e. data may not be statistically significant / numbers in each category not
                    provided;

 15     b        a. adipose/fat storage tissue releases the hormone leptin;
                 b. the (appetite) control centre is in the hypothalamus/brain;
                 c. PYY/insulin/leptin detected by the hypothalamus/brain/appetite control centre;                                        2 max
                 d. leads to feelings of satiation/suppression of appetite;
                 e. ghrelin (from stomach) increases appetite;

 15     c        amylase/lipase/peptidase/protease;
                                                                                                                                            1
                                                                         – 17 –                                           8823 – 6012M




     Question                                       Answers                                            Notes                Marks
16     a        increase the pH of the stomach
                OR
                the pH would be less acidic/higher/more alkaline;                                                             1


16     b        a. pepsin has low optimum pH/has optimum pH of 2;
                b. hydrochloric acid reduces the pH;
                c. activates enzymes that digest proteins;                                                                  2 max
                d. denatures proteins / breaks hydrogen bonds;                          mp d: Do not accept breaks down
                                                                                        proteins




17     a        a. Kupffer cells engulf/phagocytose the red blood cells/erythrocytes;
                b. hemoglobin is split into heme group and globin;
                c. globins are hydrolysed/broken down into peptides/amino acids;
                                                                                                                            3 max
                d. iron is removed from heme;
                e. breakdown of heme forms bile salts/bilirubin;

17     b        protein synthesis;                                                      Do not accept secretion               1
                                                                          – 18 –                                                        8823 – 6012M




     Question                                           Answers                                             Notes                         Marks
18     a        repolarization (of the ventricles);                                           Do not accept ventricular diastole
                                                                                                                                            1

18     b        a. cells are Y-shaped / form an interconnected network with other cells;      Accept an annotated diagram
                b. allows impulses to be transferred to many cells;                           Do not accept wording as in the stem.
                c. (intercalated) discs/continuous cytoplasm between cells;                   For mpd accept allow greater efficiency     2 max
                d. allows for rapid movement of electrical impulses between cells;            OWTTE but not effectiveness as that is
                                                                                              in the stem
18     c        a. cardiac muscle tissue is myogenic;
                b. the electrical signal is initiated in the sinoatrial node/SAN/pacemaker;
                c. the signal spreads over the atria causing them to contract;
                d. the signal passes to the atrioventricular/AV node;
                e. signal is delayed (by 0.1 seconds as it passes through the AV node)                                                    4 max
                   OR
                   delay in contraction of the ventricles;
                f. the signal passes (from the AV node) to conducting fibres;                 For mp f accept Purkinje fibres or
                                                                                              Bundle of His
                g. fibres ensure ventricles contract together;
